text:

Dubbed ‘Sunshine Saturday’, January 7 is predicted to be the busiest day of the year for holiday bookings. 
Following Brexit, Thomson and First Choice are predicting a rise in all-inclusive bookings as savvy Brits seek value from their travelling experiences. 
The booking frenzy is expected to take off in the North East too, with Newcastle International Airport prepared for “one of the busiest booking periods of the year”. 
Leon McQuaid, aviation development manager at the airport, said: “With even more choice available from Newcastle for a number of years, 2017 is set to be a special year for the airport as we expect to surpass 5 million passengers. 
“We have built a very strong route network that offers a wide variety of choice to suit all our passengers holiday needs. 
“With more than 80 direct destinations on offer along with our excellent hub connectivity, the North East travelling public can discover the world from their local airport.” 
With this in mind, here is a look at the holiday hotspots travellers from the Toon will be jetting off to over the course of 2017: Spain, the Canaries and the Balearics Ibiza, Spain (Photo: PA) 
Newcastle Airport is expecting it to be the busiest summer on record, with more than 2.1 million seats on sale. 
This includes new destinations such as Madrid and Almeria, as well as the first full year for their newest airline Vueling on Barcelona. Read More Dubai Dubai, United Arab Emirates (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
The most populated city in the UAE is growing in popularity as a travel hotspot itself, as well as a site for onward connections. 
From there, tourists will often catch flights to the likes of Perth and Sydney in Australia, Bangkok in Thailand, and India, Hong Kong or the Maldives. Greece Zante is a popular party destination in Greece (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
Newcastle Airport is offering the highest number of seats on sale in 10 years for flights to Greece. 
Destinations include the islands of Kos, Kefalonia, Rhodes, Skiathos, and Zante. Read More Pack your suitcase for a bargain holiday from £10 per person Portugal 
Demands for trip to the Algarve is expected to be high, with the a record number of seats on sale.
